Privacy Policy

Last updated:

Privacy Shield does not collect any data. All processing happens locally on your device.

Data Collection

Privacy Shield does not collect, store, or transmit any personal data or browsing information. The extension operates entirely offline and locally within your browser.

How It Works

When you use Privacy Shield, the following happens:

  • Fingerprint detection, tracker analysis, and dark pattern scanning are performed locally in your browser
  • No page content or analysis results are ever sent to any external server
  • No analytics or telemetry data is collected
  • No cookies or tracking mechanisms are used

Local Storage

The extension may use your browser's local storage to save your preferences (such as sensitivity settings and whitelisted domains). This data:

  • Never leaves your device
  • Is not accessible to us or any third party
  • Can be cleared by removing the extension

Permissions

Privacy Shield requires certain browser permissions to function:

  • Access to web pages: Required to analyze page scripts, detect trackers, and identify dark patterns
  • Storage: Used to save your local preferences and statistics

These permissions are used solely for the extension's core functionality and never for data collection.

Third Parties

Privacy Shield does not share any information with third parties because it does not collect any information in the first place.

Updates

If we ever change our privacy practices, we will update this policy. Any significant changes would require a new version of the extension.

Your Rights

Since we don't collect any data, there is no personal data to access, modify, or delete. You have complete control over the extension and can remove it at any time.
